title: Finding Equation of an LSRL Using Means and Standard Deviations
question_text: Consider a set of $n$ ordered pairs given by: $$({ x }_{ 1 },y_{ 1 }), ({ x }_{ 2 },y_{ 2 }), ({ x }_{ 3 },y_{ 3 }),..., ({ x }_{ n },y_{ n })$$ The mean and standard deviation of the $x$ -values are: $$\bar { x } =4, \quad {s }_{ x }=8$$ The mean and standard deviation of the $y$ -values are: $$\bar { y } =12, \quad { s }_{ y }=6$$ Which of the following could represent the least squares regression line?
